Deviled eggs - would not order these again. The ones with pickles were the best since it added flavor to an otherwise bland appetizer. I also prefer my deviled egg mixture to be smooth. They use ground mustard in theirs, which I didn't care for. Meatloaf - the hi-lite of the meal! I'd go back for this. Very moist. Very flavorful. Pork - this was my husband's entree. Tasted good but had more fat than he wants in lean protein. Grilled pound cake & chocolate mousse - both were ok but not worth the extra calories in my opinion. We preferred the chocolate option over the pound cake, which the server recommended & raved about.   Speaking of our server... ugh! Very loud. Too over-the-top. Used the same ridiculous lines with every table while taking orders, bringing the food, and collecting the check. Instead of trying to be Mister Funny, he should have been paying attention to our water glasses that were empty and we had to ask for refills twice. The manager doing the "table visits" barely approached our table, as he breezed by several tables at once asking us all if everything was ok. I didn't get the sense he was actually interested in a response, but rather just checking our table off his list for the hour.  Lastly, the thing that really was a bummer about our evening was the flies. Yes, flies! I expect that when I dine on a patio, but when I'm inside eating in a nicer restaurant, I don't want to have to keep shoo-ing bugs away from my food. If this is what we were experiencing in the dining room, it makes you wonder what the kitchen is like. Not good. Not good at all.

Ive heard rave reviews for 10 months from friends, today I thought Id see what the fuss was about! Appetizer Roasted Mushroom soup                    Pulled Pork Spring Rolls Entree: Crispy Grits               Deviled Eggs               Tuna Salad sandwich  We both enjoyed everything and will definitely be back- our server April was also very accommodating and professional. Its nice to know that you can have both quality plated food and exceptional service at the same place

One of our favorite spots in the Mint Hill/ Matthews area. We have taken almost every friend and family member that has visited us to New South Kitchen and a bad meal is never had. Friendly staff, rotating menu items, and excellent products keeps us coming back on a regular basis. Priced affordably and definitely get what you pay for (and then sum)!  The chicken and waffles, chicken dumplings, and anytime they have duck on the menu are great!

So I'm hanging out with my good friend, and he says to me 'Last night me and Suzanne went up to New South and had a half off bottle of wine and fried blueberry pie."   "Excuse me, what's that now? You had what now? You said fried something..."  "Blueberry pie..."  And so began my desire to dine at New South. Now I know what you're thinking: "Oh I can't wait to hear what he says about the blueberry pie!". Well stranger, I disappoint, because when I got there, the dessert offering had items on it even BETTER than aforementioned fried blueberry pie. I should have written down what they were called. I can only describe what I had as "Banana wizardry". It was a decadent, light, fluffy, syrupy banana (and rum?) cake with ice cream, reminiscent of bananas foster. Divine without being overly sweet.   We also had a full meal before that, of which I requested a surprise vegetarian meal since they weren't heavy on the vegetarian selections. Now, my theory on asking for a surprise is that it should instill in the chef a sense of adventure and a break in their routine. This was the result here. I received a wonderful mixture of items that were sides on the menu along with new creations. Each were distinct in their flavors and pleasing to the palette. Everyone's meal was great, including a big juicy burger and a salmon dish with big fluffy corn cakes.  Our waitress was extremely friendly, funny, and helpful. I'm the type to harass waitresses playfully, and she handled my idiocracy with grace and humor. The manager also made appearances at our and other tables to check on things, which I appreciate.  Bravo to this fine place.

Dinner Sep 17   Don't be swayed by the fact that this place is in a strip center.  This is a quality farm to table type restaurant.  Fresh ingredients, home made recipes, and truly fine food.   The entrees were fantastic - Of the three I tasted the Pork Loin was simply to die for!   But honestly, I could of made a meal just of of the appetizers!   Smoked Trout Spread was best fish spread I have ever had!   Crispy Pork Belly was good, but man oh man - the accompanying garnishment which consisted of "warm butternut squash & pecan salad, orange glaze" made this appetizer on of the most flavorful dishes I have had in years! truly a "wow" dish!   The Pimento Cheese spread was 100% homemade but, to my taste, the pimentos were a  bit more spicy than I like.   I will 100% go back again as this is my new favorite local restaurant in Charlotte!

First of all let me say... Our server Kelsey (whose twin sister also works there) was utterly amazing! You need to ask for her when you visit. Not only will she assist you in every way she can, she also is very informative and knowledgeable about the restaurant and menu. Kudos Kelsey! Now the food..OMG! So since it is Charlotte Restaurant Week 2015, I chose New South because it's menu was more conducive with my company's pallette..lol. The pork spring rolls were perfect and non greasy. They filled with smoky flavor and very juicy. The dipping sauce was sweet with a sneaky spice kick. There was a pickled red onion slaw that added the needed sour acidity. I had the fried green tomatoes. Since they pretty much taste the same anywhere, I did like the horseradish sauce that accompanied them. They were sliced perfectly so that you don't look like a salvage slurping the juices while chewing. Course 2 Exquisite Rainbow Trout seared to perfection and crispiness. It was paired with collard greens and a roasted pepper medley. My plate... the SUPER moistened meatloaf made with grass fed beef. Oh yeah, did I mention ALL OF THEIR INGREDIENTS COME FROM LOCAL FARMS?! OH YEAHHHHH! It's  like even if you wanted to cheat and wanted something fattening that you shouldn't.. it's still healthy and pretty much organic.. so no guilt! By the time dessert came, I was fat, full, and almost completely lazy! There was pound cake served with  homemade vanilla espresso ice cream and marinated peaches.. again OMG! Powdered Beignets...somebody loves me! Kelsey mentioned one more detail that just sent me over the edge.. COMPLIMENTARY  chocolate truffles! Look I know how this review must read however you HAVE to go and EXPERIENCE New South Kitchen. New South is the new twist in Southern Fare!

I found new south kitchen on restaurant week. I was very excited heard some good things so 4 of went. Their appetizer started with pimento cheese spread with pita bread an pork spring roll an crispy potato salad an fried green tomatoes. I loved the fried green tomatoes an pork roll were delish. The pimento cheese had red peppers too hot for me. The crispy potato salad was pieces of potato n corn an not sure what else an a poached egg on top.  That was not a hit at our table. For entrees we ordered the pork belly with collards an fried chicken with smashed potatoes an string beans an the shrimp and grits with gravy. The pork belly my friend said was perfectly cooked moist an great flavor the collards were not as good. The shrimp and grits were perfect shrimp cooked just right n grits very smooth and creamy perfect dish. The fried chicken breast was disappointing , first I smelled something an realize as I'm eating my chicken they Burnt the breading on the chicken. It was 2 chicken Brest a lot of foodi should have sent it back but I was hungry so I took the breading off. My friend said they could see it was burnt that should have never come out of the kitchen . My mashed potatoes were good but very little gravy I didn't wanna ask for more since I was already charged .50 for an extra biscuit .  If I'm at showmars or McDonalds n I want another sauce it's .25 fine I expect that but not at a very nice restaurant . Your cost should be in each entree already. So for desert we had the grilled buttermilk pound cake with vanilla ice cream an black berries . It was okay I was thinking they would just have a few grilled marks on the cake which would make it warm n add the ice cream to melt that would have been so good. No they had a sugary taste so I assume they put either sugar water or sprinkled sugar than grilled it maybe but it was too sugary for pound cake. My dad makes homemade pound cakes they are to die for . We also tried the pecan bread pudding now that was good moist not over cooked an more pecans would have been nice. I wish I could give them a 5 but a 3 is the best I can do. I would only wanna go back for some appetizers :)

We love this place.  The service is fantastic and I love what it stands for.  Sustainable, ethical, farm fresh foods. The food is delicious and so are the drinks.  This is definitely a staple of ours, and the price is very fair for what you get!  Highly recommended!

We decided to stop in here on a recent Friday night after doing some shopping it was around 8:15pm and most of the other places in the Arboretum had quite long lines.  We walked right in to no lines and a half empty bar area.  We were greeted almost immediately and were told it would be a few minutes.  It was a little weird as the host walked away and kind of left us just standing there for about 10 minutes.  When we looked around about 25-30% of the tables were empty so we weren't sure why we were waiting but, I digress.  We decided to get 3 small plates and split an entree.  We got the fried oysters, Pimento Cheese, and fried green tomatoes for our small plates and then the catfish entree, to spilt.  The server asked if we'd like the food to come out in any particular order and we said no.  I thought is was really awesome of her to ask that.  Her service was excellent, seriously, it was excellent.  She asked all the right questions, checked in on us at the right time, just fantastic.  Anyway, our 3 small plates came out.  The best thing of the 3 was the pimento cheese as it was the only thing with any flavor.  The fried green tomatoes were very bland, i had to smother them in the sauce it came with.  Would not get those again. Fried Oysters again, were bland.  i guess it's maybe a lot to ask to get flavorful shellfish this far inland.  We smeared the pimento cheese on the tomatoes and oysters just to give it some flavor.  we finished the small plates and then the cat fish was brought out.  The cat fish was good, but again, very bland. It came with a sauce that you had to smother the fish in to get any kind of flavor.  The grit cakes were just ok and my boyfriend commented that the Brussels sprouts weren't as good as the one's I make at home.    Long story short, while the service of the waitstaff was excellent, the host/hostess needs to manage things better and the for the price the food just isn't worth it.  75% of our food was flavorless and bland, though it came quickly and was piping hot.  I don't think we will be returning unless the food improves.

I just want to start off by saying this place is amazing!!!! We stopped here by chance because our normal brunch place had a long wait time and we saw New South has $3 mimosa! Winner!!  I had the chicken and waffles with a side of mac and cheese. The chicken was tender and juicy and full of flavor! The waffle was the best waffle I've had in a long time! It was so delicious paired with the syrup and homemade butter. The Mac and cheese didn't disappoint either! I was very pleased with my plate.  I also nibbled on everyone else's plate. My friend ordered a bacon, cheese & onion omelette. It was a nice portion and very flavorful and cheesy. That also came with potato wedges seasoned with sea salt -which were very tasty! My boyfriend ordered the fried chicken that came with his choice of 2 sides; mashed potatoes and collard greens. I tasted both and of course it was delicious!!   Overall I would definitely recommend this restaurant, the prices aren't bad, the food is fresh (& did I mention LOCAL?!!). I will definitely be coming back to try dinner. Brunch was a hit!!

I love to eat at locally owned restaurants rather than chains.  New South Kitchen is among the best of these.  It is just the right size.  Big enough to be a successful business yet small enough to make for friendly personal service.    All of the food is locally sourced and selected daily by the chef.  He changes the menu often to reflect the best of what is available.  Whatever you order will be prepared carefully and presented artfully.   The staff is very friendly and professional.  They know the food and can help you order just the right meal.  Just the right blend of being attentive and being out of the way.  New South Kitchen is our favorite place to take out of town guests.  We know they don't have anything like it "back home".  We also can count on treating them to a great meal and a great dining experience.

I LOVE this place. The people are great and the menu always has amazing options (some healthy and some "splurge" items). They support local farmers so lots of fresh, seasonal items. The salads are made from local lettuce- which always makes a HUGE  difference. House made dressings. Also, The desserts are made in house and can't be beaten. Homemade ice cream. Pound cake is delish!  Good selection of drinks and wines. I have a weakness for their fried okra, pulled pork sandwich and the fried green tomatoes. YUMM!!!

So what attracted me was the farm to table dining... Love Everything about that!  The food was just okay. Lots of salt and pepper needed to season everything. I ordered the deviled eggs. They give you (2) of 3 different kinds. All very bland... Disappointing.  I had the shrimp and grits with a side of collard greens. Great portion... But again, lacking flavor. I needed salt and pepper.   The best thing about this place is their service and the biscuits. The biscuits are to die for. Never had one like it.

I've eaten here twice now and each time the food and drinks have been consistently good. Staff are incredibly friendly as well. I like the comfortable seating and decor, both inside and out. At this point I've sampled over half the menu and everything was really good...I think you could order just about anything here and do well for yourself.   Additionally, prices are reasonable and portion sizes are good. There are some ways in which they could potentially liven up their menu, make it a bit more exciting, but there's something to be said in New South's reliability in terms of taste and freshness.   Of note, I have never had a salad w/ croutons keep so well (as leftovers) until I took home New South's roasted romaine salad in a doggy bag. I saved this salad (w/ it's house made croutons) for lunch the next day fully expecting to end up throwing a soggy mess into our chicken coop as a midday treat for our chooks. Instead I was met with a salad that was just as good as it had been the night before...croutons and romaine were still totally fresh and crunchy/crispy! I'm not sure how this particular salad accomplished what I'd previously assumed to be impossible...I've attempted this same feat for about 25 years now with no luck. To me, this little leftovers coup is a testament to freshness of the ingredients that this restaurant uses!

The service was great.  Very friendly clean cute place.  The food was a bit disappointing. The chicken and waffles were good, however i was expecting actual chicken not little strips.  So that was a lil sad because the flavor of the chicken was good.  My husband got a burger and that was not good at all.
It was ok...the pan fried chicken needed more  seasoning..the fried green tomatoes were cut too thick and needed more seasoning..the cake was awesome!! I also liked the white wine.

ORIGINAL POST (ALSO SEE UPDATE BELOW)  New South is a go-to dinner place for us, for a reasonably priced, solid meal.  However, tonight was disappointing on a number of points:  We were seated at a booth that had a large patch of red duct tape over a hole in the seat (I hope this is very recent and temporary??).  We then sat about 5 minutes before anyone noticed us at a table, and then it was someone other than our eventual waitress.  The waiter who did greet us took our drink orders and promptly served us, followed soon by our waitress, who from then on did fine attending our table.  I ordered the mixed greens salad and forgot to ask for dressing on the side (my fault), and yes, it had too much dressing on it, but also just a disappointing salad for $6 -- greens and not much else, and the greens not all that fresh.  I ordered the flank steak, which I've had before and loved, but tonight I could only eat about 1/2 of it because of how chewy most of the meat was (some I just had to stop chewing and spit out; other parts I could get through by cutting really small bites and chewing a lot).  The dish was also overly sauced with a very salty brine that seemed to be mostly just W sauce.  The potatoes were pretty tasteless and watery (with some soft chunks in there too).  Green beans were crisp-cooked and good.  On the plus side, my husband ordered the pork, which he said was tasty and tender.  Also, you can't beat $4 for a generous pour of a very decent house cabernet.  Add to that their participation in Citipass and other discounts, and I am willing to overlook an occasional disappointing meal since the price is right, but tonight, yes, I was very disappointed in one of my favorite non-fancy restaurants.  UPDATE:  After posting this review above, the owner contacted me and offered to comp my meal.  I suggested I just visit again and give them another try, which we did tonight (11/11/11).  Everything was superb!  Got seated quickly, table visited & serviced promptly.  I had the red fish entree, and my husband had the pork shoulder.  Both were perfect, and the sides were great.  Loved the fresh greens "slaw" on the fish, and the braised squash.  Cooking time was still just a tad longer than some places, but the dining room and bar were both packed (Carrier Classic on the big screens), so I imagine there was just a temporary backlog as we were there at peak time.  I appreciate that New South offers deals in Citipass, etc.  Their menu is already affordable, so that makes it an even better deal.  I spoke to the chef/owner and his wife; both were gracious and interested in our impressions, and they comped our meal tonight.  It doesn't get much classier than that.  Thanks, New South.  We will be back!

I want to start off saying I referred a few friends to New South all have thoroughly enjoyed apart from one neutral comment from one. Which the couple that had went there for lunch, said the buffet was limited and that it was not over the top like she had anticipated. Maybe sounds like they need to change out menus for lunch and brunch.  I have only ever went there for dinner. It has always been awesome. We have tried most of the items on the menu. Starting on the kid's menu, the mac & cheese is awesome. It is completely homemade and delicious. The appetizers from Fried Green Tomatoes, Cheese plate and Redneck Cheese board our all wonderful. The grilled romaine salad is another favorite. We have the rotisserie chicken, the pork, and typically get the veggie plate that is served with only what' s best in season and the freshest. There desserts are tasty too and they have half priced wine tues for an extra bonus. Check this place out as I can only promise you that your dinner will be a delight, cute little classy southern joint. Enjoy!
Authentic. Great atmosphere and service. Emily recommended the trout. She was right. Had a wonderful anniversary. Thanks again!

WOW! Very nice. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Large group handled well. Food was excellent as well. I had the "Fickle Burger" and my wife had the roasted Chicken.... her chicken fell off the bone. She LOVED it. My burger was prepared just how I ordered it and was very good -- and unique (included Fried Pickles on the burger). Wine was 1/2 price to boot. Add this place to your must dine while in Charlotte especially with a large crowd. Food is all local grass feed and hormone free. Several in our group were stating this is there new favorite place in town.

Dinner at 5:30 on November 16, 2015 Great food. Pork and chicken cooked to perfection!  Sweet potato side not cooked and very hard so could not eat the larger pieces. Greens, creamed potatoes and green beans cooked to perfection. Mike was our waiter and was slower than molasses! Be sure you do not have him if you are in a hurry. Will return!!

Unplanned dinner stop on a Friday night around 7:30. Actually got seated right away. Server was very friendly, personable and knowledgeable. The food is locally sourced - all NC or SC (fish primarily). We had 3 small plates: flat bread, pork belly and a fried green tomato. 2 glasses of wine were reasonably priced. Small plates were $10 and very filling.  The crispy pork was fabulous! 3 pieces with sweet potato and pecans with orange glaze. We almost arm wrestled got the last piece.  The fried green tomato was firm and properly done. Nice ranch sauce.  The flatbread was good not great.   Overall a very nice experience with excellent food. Will come again with reservations

This place is a little gem! I am so glad that there are good places to eat in the Arboretum. I went here recently with a group and everything was delicious! I had the N.C. Shrimp and grits. It was very filling and delicious, although it still can't compete with Charleston's. Very good food and excellent service!

Food is four stars, but service was one star. This restaurant was highly recommended to us, so it was quite disappointing when the service from the beginning to the end was terrible. Our waiter seemed to love his other tables around us, but was lackluster to us, possibly because we were college students and therefore he thought we were broke?! We were treated with utter disrespect and were basically ignored all night-drinks were never refilled, dishes were never cleared from the beginning, and it took at least 30 minutes after we were done eating to get our check. Thankfully a kind young waitress finally cleared our plates and gave us the bill, probably seeing that we had been waiting for so long. Never judge a book by its cover!!

When it comes to southern cooking with an modern culinary flair, this place is awesome. I had shrimp and grits, my wife had their fried catfish, and we shared their fried green tomatoes appetizer. It was simply delicious.   The service was wonderful. That atmosphere was elegant and nice. Definitely a place for a nice romantic dinner or brunch after church.   I highly recommend it.

Awesome dinner....tried the pimento sausage won tons -excellent, followed by porkloin with andouille gravy and red pepper marmalade with a side a mashed potatoes and a fresh baked biscuits- HEAVEN! Attentive service and a nice cocktail menu too.  Wish I had room for the grilled pound cake with blueberries....next time for sure!

Customer service is horrible if you go between lunch and dinner when they are not as busy. Our waiter it seems was a manager and it took him FOREVER to take our order...we actually had to finally get up and ask for someone to come take our order. Then when we were ready to leave it took FOREVER for the waiter to come and pick up our payment. We finally went to the host and said we wanted to pay only to be told to go back to our table and our waiter will come to us. Excuse me Mr. but I was in a rush and I don't feel like waiting FOREVER again. Smh ridiculous. Oh yeah and food was "ok".

My first time coming here was for restaurant week.   And I'm so glad that we came.  My husband and I ordered the pull pork rolls and the fried green tomatoes.   The fried green tomatoes was just ok. But I loved the pull pork rolls.  Very good.   My husband ordered the pork chop medallions and I ordered the pan fried chicken.  Both dishes was delicious.    For dessert, my husband got the pecan pie bread budding and I got the shortcake.   I was very pleased with this place.  This restaurant is now on my favorite list.   Good job New South.  :)

Went with 3 friends, happily surprised with half price bottles of wine on Tuesday! Waiter was friendly. They were out of shrimp, and I was really wanting the shrimp and grits but got the Carolina burger instead. It was yummy and thick! Our table split the fries green tomatoes, they were delicious!!!

Huge fan of New South! I stumbled across this by accident for lunch and it was so great we've been back every weekend since. Not only is the food delicious it is also all local which is very important to me. Of course this means it's a little pricier but trust me, it's well worth it.   The wait staff has always been pleasant! The bartenders are super knowledgeable about the menu and make a delicious cucumber cooler. Try out New South - you won't be disappointed.
Best shrimp and grits I've ever had. All of the food is really great, fast and courteous service make this place one of the best in town.

Since moving to Charlotte in October of 2008, this has quickly become one of our favorite restaurants.  We have dined at New South no less than 20 times in the past six months and have never been disappointed.    Tucked away in the Arboretum, it has a rather cozy feeling for a place with a more "modern" design.  Our server (Jim) is very knowledgeable about the menu and is able to answer every question we have.  New South has a really cool mix of "comfort" foods.  I think we have tried at least half of the menu including a lot of their nightly specials.  The deep fried turkey (Sunday) is a favorite - I also like their meatloaf, the chuck roast, flank steak, and my favorite (which is the Monday night special) Fried Chicken.  The Grilled romaine salad and artisan cheese trays are great starters and the apple Charlotte is their best dessert.  I highly recommend New South for dinner.  They have different diner specials and drink specials every night so you may want to call or visit their website before you go.  I know that Tuesday is 1/2 bottle wine, Sunday is 1/2 wine by the glass.
The fried chicken is perfectly seasoned, tender, juicy & possibly the best I have had!  Will definitely be back to try one of the daily chefs specials.

I've tried to think of a better way to put it, but in short New South.. confused me. Looking at the menu online prepped me for one type of restaurant (maybe something along the lines of Bask), upon entering to the bar area and the array of printed booth cushions and four tops I immediately got a more family feel... not a bad thing, the casual setting was comfortable and welcoming. Then, our server arrived wearing jeans and a tshirt with chuck taylors (okay this is a little more casual than I expected) and then we received our water in beer-labeled pint glasses. I understand the concept of bringing an upscale and contemporary cuisine to the masses, I just think there is a way to do it without making me feel like I'm in three restaurants at once.   But, onto the food. Our server was pretty quick to let us know the pulled pork spring rolls were about to be 86'd, so if we wanted them we should jump on that. They had sounded good, so we grabbed an order. We then ordered the swordfish and the shrimp and grits. The rolls arrived, and I couldn't accept the contrast in consistencies. It was a perfect fried shell, but the inside was such a mushy pulled pork filling it was an odd mouth feel. The sauce was nice, kind of a thinned out and spiced up sweet thai chili sauce.   The swordfish was extremely pungent. I hadn't ordered swordfish in a while but I felt like the pieces could have coated the corner of the room in fishiness. Smell aside, it tasted great, and the ham vinaigrette was a nice touch. Really the whole dish was great as long as you avoided the cucumber slaw. The shrimp and grits had great components, but together didn't hold much in the flavor department.  Overall attentive service, water glasses always filled, and the food had some good flavors. Also, really nice portion size on the big plates. I think when they release a new menu I'll try them again, but they aren't currently on my charlotte top restaurants list. And they are located along the curve of the strip with Le Peep, not towards the Taco Bell/Walmart area.

We have been here several times. The food has been consistently good. I like the farm to table concept, although the prices are still a little high even when this is taken into account. My kids like the waffle and order it every time. The biscuits are delicious! The burgers are tasty. The shrimp and grits are good, but I wish the portions were larger. I was still hungry after eating it the last time and ended up eating everyone else's leftovers. The half roasted chicken is very flavorful.   The service has been hit or miss. We had one dining experience where the waiter ignored us the whole meal. We had taken guests from NY for dinner and it was embarrassing. We had to chase him down for the check and it took over 30 mins. We wanted dessert, but decided to cut our losses and go elsewhere.

We decided to come here for Easter Sunday, basically it was one of the only places I could reserve. I was dining with my mother and grandmother and we were immediately seated. The place has a nice decor, colored chalk boards list the local farmers they use and also the local brews they offer. We came at 11:15 so this was brunch. We started with the fried green tomatoes, not my number one favorite but a top contender. My mother got the penne pasta with chicken, grandmother got the salmon with grit cakes and I got the lemon chicken sandwich and got the braised greens in the side.  Since we were served brunch we were also offered a biscuit or a sugar muffin- sugar muffin please!!! All 3 of us were happy with what we choose. Moms pastas had some good flavors but to me you can order that anywhere, nanas salmon had all kinda stuff going on, the grit cakes, Brussels sprouts, and the salmon on top, all were cooked GREAT! She also got a side of Mac n cheese which was totally not worth the extra $5 they charged her. My lemon chicken sandwich had goat cheese and a tomato compote with a nice herbal mayonnaise, I took the bread off for carb purposes and was happy with the way it tasted! The sugar muffin ended up being a happy surprise and dessert!
Best food in South Charlotte. Truly!  Local farm-to-table, local brew...amazing food EVERY SINGLE TIME.

I've got a lot of business meetings each week. What I love about this place- tables are not crowded into each other. There's enough  room for my plate to fit on the table- and also all my notebooks and meeting essentials. The staff has always greeted us, offered us info on the daily specials. Their beef is grass fed, and the burgers are amazing (they accommodate  me with bread free dishes- and never seem surprised or dismayed when I ask). Their side dishes are great portions and scrumptious!! Loved their roasted Brussels sprouts. They also are conscious of our meeting discussion, and have perfected when to ask us a question "how is your food today"? Or "would you like more water"? in a way that is not disruptive to our conversations. This is a great atmosphere, a little slow to receive food- but perfect for a business lunch or to catch up with an old friend.
Consistency! This is one of our favorite spots in Charlotte, the food is always excellent and the service is on the same level. Very happy they brought pork belly back to the menu.
Everything is to love at The South Kitchen! We have become regulars. It's nice to feel welcomed and leave full.

Finally ate here for queens feast and wasn't disappointed! The wait for a table was 2 hours but we happily ate at the bar and were served super fast! Great staff and amazing food. The pork belly was so creamy and the shrimp and grits were up to a Charlestown girl's exacting standards. A great date spot!

We stumbled across this place when we were down far south on Providence Road.  The look and feel of this place felt like something I would see on Restaurant Impossible after the makeover....not sure why...  For an appetizer, we ordered the Pecan Crusted Goat cheese...wow...this restaurant is not f'n around when they call these items 'Small Plates'.  The goat cheese was good, but about the size of a super ball you get in a vending machine....  Next...the bread and butter came out...I love bread and butter...this I did not love.  It wasn't 'just ok', or a non-factor....it was horrible..if that is even possible for bread.  Usually you can just salvage the crust, or just drench it with butter, but not this time.  It was kind of like eating compressed dust...  For dinner, we got the KT's Penne, which was very delicious.  The sauce was unique and fresh tasting with some good bacon mixed throughout.  They should bottle it up....why not?  Overall, the service was great and the food (except the bread...wow) was good.

New South catered an event in our home for our organization Crohn's and Colitis foundation. Couldn't recommend more! The food was beautifully presented and tasted great. The staff came in and set it up with a full bar effortlessly. And they were a pleasure to have in our home and work with.  And the clean up was as seamless as the set up. THANK YOU and we thoroughly enjoyed our evening.

We went here because they have a prix fixe for $25.  It includes an entree, an appetizer, a glass of house wine, and dessert.  Not bad. The menu itself was pretty awesome.  Went with a total of 5 people, two of the guys didn't even go prix fixe.  And the bill was still respectable.  We went on a Tuesday I think, and it was 1/2 price wine bottles as well. We decided to go family style on the apps.  Fried green tomatoes, a meatball flatbread, a tuna spread, "redneck" cheese board (pimento haha), and mussels.  They were all delicious.  If I had to rank them, hmm I'd have to say flatbread, tuna, tomatoes, mussels, cheese. For entrees, one guy got the pork tenderloin.  2 of us got the baked chicken off the prix fixe, and the other 2 got the roast chicken from the regular menu.  The house wine was not bad, a bit sweet for cabernet, and the shiraz we got was peppery.   Then we got dessert, we also kinda split up between bananas/rumcake, butterscotch bread pudding, chocolate mousse, and a lemon tart.  Damn, it was a nice surprise and pretty good.  We'll definitely be back.  Oh yeah, the decor is kinda cool, like almost homey, but still modern enough to have a few flat screens at the bar.  I would describe this place as kind of a classy southern place, but not over the top.

More like a 3 1/2 rating but Yelp doesn't allow half stars. Our waiter was personable and attentive.    For appetizer had fried green tomatoes, so good! For main course had shrimp and grits which were phenomenal, and did not lack salt at all as mentioned by another yelper. Also had the special, braised short ribs on a bed of grits..so moist it melted in your mouth! Kids menu had fried turkey with mashed potatoes and green beans, meat was moist and green beans crispy.  For drinks had the Moscow mule, which was served in a  mason jar not a copper mug no mint on side. It was disappointing, would not order again. The kids lemonade was delicious, not Minute Maid crap. The iced tea was ok, but nothing to write home about.  Overall we would visit again if in the area, food was very good and fresh.

I was in town for a quick business trip and had dinner with great friends. I wanted Southern cuisine.  Every bite was amazing! The fried green tomatoes were perfection! The red snapper divine and the sweet potatoes just the way I like it! The fried blueberry pie was the best way to end a delicious meal. It was so good I forgot to photograph.  Great service and great food! I will return my next visit to Charlotte.

I like the concept of this restaurant. The food is locally sourced and fresh. The dishes are traditional southern, but prepared in a modern gourmet way. The shrimp and grits are outstanding. The seasoning and sauces were flavorful without being overwhelming. Highly recommended.
